alfredsnippet.snippet:
"Science is often presented as a seamless edifice of certainty, 'rational' all the way through, where in reality it has the texture of Dundee cake: currants of 'fact' and raisins of well-tried theory contained in a dough of rhetoric and supposition. It relies far more on untried dogma than is commonly admitted."

- The privatisation of science, Colin Tudge, New Statesman, 2004/04/30
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Science Has the Texture of Dundee Cake
